intro: Horkelia capitata, commonly known as the yellowhead gentian, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its compact, hairy stems and clusters of small, bright yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in mountainous regions. It belongs to the Gentianaceae family, known for its showy, often blue or yellow flowers. Horkelia capitata is often found in open habitats such as meadows and slopes.
